required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Triple-arm Trial of pH (Tri-pH) Effect on Live Birth After ICSI

brief_summary.textblock: The culturing human embryo in vitro is a process of myriad contributing elements. From these factors is the pH of embryo culture media, which is crucial for embryo development. The investigators plan to examine three different pH values of the culture media on the live birth rate of in vitro cultured human embryos.

detailed_description.textblock: In vitro fertilisation laboratory is the black box in which early human embryo development of infertile couple occurs. This laboratory holds many variables such as incubator type, air quality, brands of culture media, culture temperature and the pH of culture medium. Despite the importance of the culture medium pH, there is no single RCT has examined its effect on live birth rate post in vitro fertilisation. The investigators of this study believe that leaving this crucial element to the wishes of large companies and media designers is unwise. This RCT aims to provide a conclusive answer on pH effect on live birth rate of in vitro cultured human embryos.

primary_outcome.description: delivery of one or more viable infants > 20 weeks of gestation

secondary_outcome.description: registered positive hCG ≥14 days after egg collection
presence of a foetal sac with a foetal heart beat on ultrasound > 7 weeks of presence of a foetal sac with a foetal heart beat on ultrasound > 7 weeks of gestation
Continued pregnancy after 20 weeks of gestation
Loss of pregnancy before week 20 of gestation
Delivery of one or more viable infants ≥ 37 weeks of gestation
Number of viable neonates per number of embryos transferred

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative live birth after one fresh and one frozen transfer
secondary_outcome.description: Registered live birth from one fresh and one frozen cycles
Delivery of one or more viable infants <37 weeks of gestation
Delivery of one or more viable infants <32 weeks of gestation
delivery of nonviable babies > 20 weeks of gestation
Viable neonate < 2500 gm within 24 hours of delivery
delivery of congenitally malformed babies

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 18 hours of inseminating the oocyte
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of 2 pronuclei17±1 hr post insemination/ICSI

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 72 hours of inseminating the oocytes
secondary_outcome.description: registered divided embryo per fertilised oocyte

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 72 hours of inseminating the oocytes
secondary_outcome.description: embryo of 7 or more appropriate-size blastomeres with < 10 fragmentation by volume per Istanbul Consensus

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 5-7 days of inseminating the oocytes
secondary_outcome.description: Formed blastocyst of any grade on day 5 or 6 per fertilized oocyte
Blastocyst of ≥ 3.1.1.grading per Istanbul Consensus on day 5
Number of cryopreserved blastocyst on day 5 and 6 per fertilized oocyte
Embryo Utilization rate (number of cryopreserved embryos added to the transferred embryos per fertilized oocytes
number of cryopreserved embryos added to the transferred embryos per fertilized oocytes

arm_group.description: In this arm, the intervention is to culture the inseminated oocytes in vitro in a pH of 7.2±0.02 from day 0 to 5/6 post IVF/ICSI. Then according to the result of the randomization, women will receive their embryos that will be cultured in this pH on either Day 3 or Day 5/6 post IVF/ICSI.

In this arm, the intervention is to culture the inseminated oocytes in vitro in a pH of 7.3±0.02 from day 0 to 5/6 post IVF/ICSI. Then according to the result of the randomization, women will receive their embryos that will be cultured in this pH on either Day 3 or Day 5/6 post IVF/ICSI.

In this arm, the intervention is to culture the inseminated oocytes in vitro in a pH of 7.4±0.02 from day 0 to 5/6 post IVF/ICSI. Then according to the result of the randomization, women will receive their embryos that will be cultured in this pH on either Day 3 or Day 5/6 post IVF/ICSI.

intervention.intervention_name: Transfer embryo from pH 7.20±0.02 on either Day 3 or day 5/6
intervention.description: Post IVF/ICSI and according to the result of the randomization process, women will receive embryo from their oocytes that will be cultured in pH of 7.20±0.02.

intervention.intervention_name: Transfer embryo from pH 7.3±0.02 either Day 3 or day 5/6
intervention.description: Post IVF/ICSI and according to the result of the randomization process, women will receive embryo from their oocytes that will be cultured in pH of 7.3±0.02.

intervention.intervention_name: Transfer embryo from pH of 7.4±0.02 on either Day 3 or day 5/6
intervention.description: Post IVF/ICSI and according to the result of the randomization process, women will receive embryo from their oocytes that will be cultured in pH of 7.4±0.02 from day 0 to 5/6

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Women age of ≥ 18 to ≤ 40
2. BMI of ≤ 31
3. Normal responder (≥ 10 antral follicle count (AFC) during basal ultrasound examination)
4. PCOS
5. Women who have ≥ 1 year of primary or secondary infertility
6. Tubal factor (unilateral, bilateral obstruction or salpingectomy)
7. Normal semen parameters
8. Male factor: oligoasthenozoospermia or obstructive azoospermia
9. Women who are undergoing their first IVF or ICSI cycle or second IVF Cycle with previous successful attempt
10. Women who will undergo only fresh embryo transfer
11. Women who have normal endometrial thickness (8-12) and echo-pattern at the time of hCG trigger
12. Women who have normal transvaginal ultrasound during the follicular phase (defined as no intra cavity pathology; e.g. submucousal myomas, polyps or septa)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Women who had unilateral oophorectomy
2. Women who had uterine pathology or abnormality
3. Women or their husbands who had abnormal karyotyping
4. Women with history of recurrent abortions or repeated implantation failures
5. Women who had uncontrolled diabetes
6. Women with diagnosed or undiagnosed liver or renal disease
7. Women who had a history of severe ovarian hyperstimulation
8. Women who had history of malignancy or borderline pathology
9. Women who will not meet the inclusion criteria
10. Women who will refuse to participate in the study
11. Women with endometriosis
12. Patient undergoing PGS or PGD
13. Severe male factor and non-obstructive azoospermia.
